name: crumpet
content:
crumpet noun
(BREAD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a small, round type of bread with holes in one side that is often eaten hot with butter: We had tea and buttered crumpets.
JohnGollop/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe table was set with a white table-cloth, tea for three, and a huge plate of toast, crumpets and butter.I'll make a cup of coffee and toast some crumpets by the fire.Do you think the queen is going to invite you round for tea and crumpets?Every night the baker worked to make scones, baps, cottage loaves, crumpets.

crumpet noun
(WOMAN)
[ U ] UK slang offensive an offensive word for one or more people, usually women, who are considered to be sexually attractive
